course_name:
The ultimate guide to marketing, 
branding & customer understanding
course_description: The tools of Marketing might change often..but a true marketer sticks to the fundamentals! What makes a true marketing professional successful? What role does 'brand' have to play? Find out here!
WhatYouLearn: Fundamentals of marketing
Difference between product and brand
How the big-tech created their brands
Case study applications of marketing concepts
WhatsInForYou: Lifetime access to 25 years of professional experience
compressed into 1.5 hours of learning
Preference for experiential learning opportunities that we
source for you in this domain
A certificate of completion and a chance to get your
in-session case / project reviewed by the expert

episodes.title: 1. Who is a “marketer”?
episodes.description: You have heard this term before but what does it actually mean? Are you a marketer or are you just someone who has read marketing books?

episodes.title: 2. Anil's marketing journey
episodes.description: 26 years of experience summed up in just 3 minutes for you!

episodes.title: 3. The evil behind marketing “hacks”
episodes.description: The truth behind glamorous, quick marketing “hacks” and the importance of learning the crux of marketing - the fundamentals.

episodes.title: 4. The fundamentals of marketing
episodes.description: Ever felt confused about so many marketing terms being thrown around? Brand? Sales? Advertisement? Not after watching this episode.

episodes.title: 5. Test your marketing fundamentals
episodes.description: Let us test whether you have understood the essence of marketing fundamentals and can put it to use!

episodes.title: 6. Marketing fundamentals at your workplace
episodes.description: Applying everything you have learnt so far in your current/future workplace.

episodes.title: 7A. Customer understanding - Decoded
episodes.description: The importance of getting to know your customers and the value it adds to your organisation.

episodes.title: 7B. Customer understanding - Decoded
episodes.description: The importance of getting to know your customers and the value it adds to your organisation.

episodes.title: 8. Test your consumer understanding
episodes.description: We have learnt what consumer understanding means but can you translate it to the real world and prove your worth as a marketer? Test it out.

episodes.title: 9. The real meaning of ‘Brand’
episodes.description: Brand is a word which is a word thrown around quite lightly and used interchangeably with a lot of terms....But what does it actually mean?

episodes.title: 10. 'Product' and how it correlates with ‘Brand’
episodes.description: We all know what a product is, but how does it correlate to the brand and how does it all fall into place with the bigger picture of marketing.

episodes.title: 11. Product and brand - summarised
episodes.description: Everything we have learnt about product and brand in under a minute!

episodes.title: 12A. Deep dive into the nuances of ‘Branding’
episodes.description: We have learnt what a brand is, so now let us take it a step further and understand the heart of a brand and how it resonates with marketing and the terms associated with it.

episodes.title: 12B. Deep dive into the nuances of ‘Branding’
episodes.description: We have learnt what a brand is, so now let us take it a step further and understand the heart of a brand and how it resonates with marketing and the terms associated with it.

episodes.title: 13. Marketing in a nutshell
episodes.description: Everything you can possibly learn about marketing..and more!

episodes.title: 14. Marketing in the real world
episodes.description: How to systematically and smartly apply everything you have just learnt about marketing in the real world. Take the world by a marketing storm!

course_name:
Private Equity Investing:
The What and How!
course_description: The world of Private Equity investing is large and complicated. But not if you understand the nuances correctly. That is the aim of this series - to give you an inside view into the PE way of investing!
WhatYouLearn: Fundamentals of investing
The process/steps of PE investing
A day in the life of a PE investor
A real life case study of PE investing
WhatsInForYou: Lifetime access to 'inside information' in the PE space
compressed into 1 hour of learning
Preference for experiential learning opportunities that we
source for you in this domain
A certificate of completion and a chance to get your
in-session case / project reviewed by the expert

episodes.title: 1. What is investing - the basics!?
episodes.description: The perfect introduction - what is ‘investing’ - a word we hear almost everyday - and what are the different ways you can choose to invest.

episodes.title: 2. Public Investing v/s. Private Investing
episodes.description: Must know concepts - what are the obvious (and more subtle) differences between public and private investing and the pros & cons of each.

episodes.title: 3. The actual, ‘Private Equity’ way of investing - an overview
episodes.description: A Private Equity firm’s approach to investing - the 5 golden points to analyse before investing and the logic behind each of them. Aaand, you’re learning it first-hand from the best in class!

episodes.title: 4. Deep Dive 1: Analysing the Industry
episodes.description: Judging the industry on 4 subtle metrics: growth, margins, competitive nature and the threat of disruption. Each more important than the other.

episodes.title: 5. Deep Dive 2: Evaluating a specific Company
episodes.description: Have you always wanted to analyse an interesting company (maybe your favourite one), decipher the direction it is going to move in and how it is going to perform? Well, now you can - in a way that leading PEs around the world do.

episodes.title: 6. Deep Dive 3: Assessing the Management of a Company
episodes.description: A company is nothing without the people who run it. This episode explains how management teams can be assessed and why it is so important to check their competence before betting your money on the company they run.

episodes.title: 7. Deep Dive 4: Valuation! Valuation! Valuation!
episodes.description: The single most important metric that can make or break a deal. This episode will tell you about the subtle nuances in using a particular valuation technique while analysing industries and companies. And why it is the heart of a PE investment.

episodes.title: 8. Deep Dive 5: Reference checks
episodes.description: Millions of dollars are at stake in each PE investment transaction - doing reference checks is a no brainer! But on whom? With what motive? When?

episodes.title: 9. Stepping into the PE shoes
episodes.description: A day in the life of a person at a Private Equity firm? What skills do you require to make it in a PE firm? A window into one of the most revered and desired professions, do you have what it takes?

course_instructor_post: VP @ Pvt. Investment Office | Ex-Citi | Ex-BAML
course_description: Investment Banking is super intense, financially rewarding, and extremely exciting! Right from brainstorming potential M&As to sourcing deals to pitching to analysis to project management to final closure - the Investment Banker does it all...and with utmost skill!
WhatYouLearn: Investment Banking basics, meaning
The IB process and breakdown of each stage
Real-life case study of an IB deal
Skills required to be in IB
WhatsInForYou: Lifetime access to 'inside information' in the IB space
compressed into 1 hour of learning
Preference for experiential learning opportunities that we
source for you in this domain
A certificate of completion and a chance to get your
in-session case / project reviewed by the expert

episodes.title: 1. Investment banks in a nutshell
episodes.description: Investment banking is a term which catches everyone’s attention but what exactly are they? What work do they do? How are they structured? Everything you have ever wondered about investment banks in this episode.

episodes.title: 2. Mergers and Acquisitions - introduction
episodes.description: Zee -Sony merger, Vodafone-Idea merger, Walmart’s acquisition of Flipkart. I am sure you have heard of these multi-billion dollar transactions but do you know what they mean and is that all investment banks do?

episodes.title: 3. The reason why M&As are done
episodes.description: We can never fully understand what mergers and acquisitions are until we know why they take place? What drives these companies to take the billion dollar step? Let’s find out.

episodes.title: 4. The M&A process - decoded
episodes.description: A deep dive into the entire process, right from the first handshake to the closing of the deal and who better to guide us through it than an investment banker himself.

episodes.title: 5. Test it out!
episodes.description: One of the biggest and most exciting acquisitions of all time simplified - for you to decipher and analyse. Can you think like the best?

episodes.title: 6. Role of investment banks in the M&A process
episodes.description: Now that we know everything about M&A, let us hangout with the experts, learn what they do, how they do and derive insights from their work so we can master it.

episodes.title: 7. ‘Pitching’ under a microscope
episodes.description: Inbound pitches v/s. Outbound pitches. Information from public sources v/s. private sources. The story, the structure, the valuation estimates. All very interesting and intricate!

episodes.title: 8. The IB transaction process post mandate
episodes.description: Teaser, information memorandum, business plans, client discussions, etc. All these terms probably seem alien to you - let’s change that by learning how a typical IB transaction takes place after a mandate has been won.

episodes.title: 9. Transaction process elements - in depth
episodes.description: We learnt the transaction process and we know what the elements are but let us now learn those elements in detail with real life examples.

episodes.title: 10. Valuation in a deal
episodes.description: Valuation, the single most powerful term which shapes every deal. Let us learn how it takes place, terms associated with it, it’s position in a transaction and what follows it.

episodes.title: 11. Deal proces - summary
episodes.description: Everything we have learnt so far in under a minute, let’s revise!

episodes.title: 12. Evaluation and selection of bids
episodes.description: We have got tons of offers from lots of investors…what now? How to evaluate bids (yes, there is more to it than money) and select the perfect partner, since there is nothing worse than selecting an investor or a partner who is not compatible with the organisation.

episodes.title: 13. An Investment Banker’s time and skills
episodes.description: I am sure by now you’ve decided that you want to become an investment banker too, but do you know what their long (yet fulfilling) 18h day comprises? Or what it actually takes to get into investment banking and excel at it? Let’s find out.

episodes.title: 14. Where is the IB industry headed
episodes.description: Everyday new industries come up and some industries go extinct with the rise of AI and machines. How do all these factors affect the Investment banking industry? What is the future looking like? Find out here!

episodes.title: 15. Conclusion
episodes.description: Wrapping up the series :) Reach out on: hello@thenextgig.net with your questions!

course_name:
Investing through the Venture 
Capital Lens
course_description: As a VC, you've got to think like a founder, an investor, a strategist, a consultant and sometimes, even a friend. Exciting, isn't it? You get: immense learning AND to be a part of one of the most prestigious roles in the world! Figure out why in this TNG Original!
WhatYouLearn: Venture Capital basics, meaning
The VC process and breakdown of each stage
Real-life case study of a VC deal
Skills required to be in a VC firm
WhatsInForYou: Lifetime access to 'inside information' in the VC space
compressed into 1 hour of learning
Preference for experiential learning opportunities that we
source for you in this domain
A certificate of completion and a chance to get your
in-session case / project reviewed by the expert

episodes.title: 1. The Private Investor landscape in India
episodes.description: Like startups and companies, there are multiple types of investors too. Each with a different focus, agenda and mode of operation. Here’s why it’s important to know the difference.

episodes.title: 2.  VC funds - the two types
episodes.description: Traditional funds v/s. Evergreen funds. Which type do you think is more popular? Which one performs better? Take a guess!

episodes.title: 3. Stage 1: Ideation
episodes.description: As much as the world undermines the importance of “ideation”, it is the first, most logical, step to take towards building a valuable VC portfolio. Go wrong in this step and the VC is doomed. Find out why in this episode.

episodes.title: 4. Stage 2: Sourcing a deal
episodes.description: A deep dive into the entire process, right from the first handshake to the closing of the deal and who better to guide us through it than an investment banker himself.

episodes.title: 5. Stage 3: Diligence processes
episodes.description: Betting your money on something without checking it thoroughly is illogical (and risky, duh!). The founders, the market, the competitive landscape - everything is subject to diligence. (Play close attention to some funky terms coming your way in this episode)

episodes.title: 6. Due diligence - the PE angle v/s. the VC angle
episodes.description: One concept - due diligence. But very different motives & outcomes of the DD between PEs and VCs. Each has its own metrics - let’s find out what they are, why they are important and to what extent they differ.

episodes.title: 7. Stage 4: Negotiations
episodes.description: The word ‘negotiations’ is exciting enough. Think of founders doing it with venture capital investors and you’ve got some super explosive discussions taking place. See how, as a VC, you navigate the tricky waters of deciding how to ‘value’ a startup.

episodes.title: 8. Stage 5: Portfolio Management
episodes.description: If you thought that the work of a VC firm ended after money hit the startup’s bank account - think again! VC firms take pride in working with founders in reshaping how their product, and the world, is seen - here’s how.

episodes.title: 9. Stage 6: Exiting the investment
episodes.description: What is a “fund life”? How does the “term sheet” come into play here? How can a VC actually exit its investment and what are the “protocols” for exit? Where does the stake go? Too many questions - equal number of answers.

episodes.title: 10. A week in the life of a VC
episodes.description: No two days are the same. As someone who will potentially work in a VC soon (we’re hoping), here’s your cheat sheet into what skills you’d require, what your work week would look like and whether you’d be a good fit in the VC or not - we’ll obviously let you judge for yourself!

episodes.title: 11. The case study - setting up the context
episodes.description: An interesting, live, case study of a Creator Economy startup. Here is the link to the document for your ready reference: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1RdEeXLLouNBMBf6ytKkudCSY7Yp1KdFq/view?usp=sharing

episodes.title: 12. The case study - deep dive #1
episodes.description: What are the initial points of work for you as a VC analyst when you’ve “found” Credifluencer. Or even before that - how did you find Credifluencer? What were your first thoughts? How will you get the ball rolling in the process? Answers - here.

episodes.title: 13. The case study - deep dive #2
episodes.description: You’ve done all your pre-work. Now you’re on the founder call. And this sounds exciting, doesn’t it? Collaborative discussions are how you, as a VC, will answer the question - “Was I correct in thinking about Credifluencer in the way I did?”

episodes.title: 14. The case study - deep dive #3
episodes.description: THE IC MEETING! It’s finally here. What’s the decision going to be? How well convinced are YOU, as a VC, about Credifluencer.

episodes.title: 15. The case study - deep dive #4
episodes.description: Congratulations on your first deal!! Is that it? Is the process over? Definitely not. What next? Find out here.

episodes.title: 16. Conclusion
episodes.description: Just a summary of the entire session - spoon feeding you so that you ensure you haven’t missed out on anything during the episodes!

course_name:
Chief of Staff ~ Decoded 
The MNC version
instructor_creds: CA | 6+ years of being a Chief of Staff
course_description: The role that's been picking up some serious traction over the past few years - Chief of Staff is as exciting as it is coveted nowadays. If 'Chief of Staff' had a synonym, it would be versatility. 1 person ~ Multiple hats ~ ideating, strategizing, coordinating, executing and driving business forward. Sounds fun, right?
course_role: Strategy, CEO's office, Chief of Staff
WhatYouLearn: Who is a Chief of Staff and what does he/she do
The roles and responsibilities of a Chief of Staff
Do's and don'ts to become a good CoS
Skills required to be in a CoS role
WhatsInForYou: Lifetime access to 'inside information' in the CoS space
compressed into 1 hour of learning
Preference for experiential learning opportunities that we
source for you in this domain
A certificate of completion and a chance to get your
in-session case / project reviewed by the expert

episodes.title: 1. An introduction to the term ‘Chief of Staff’
episodes.description: A popular term in today’s times - thanks to the entire startup revolution - Chief of Staff is a pretty funky word. But its roots of origin lie elsewhere. Get a glimpse of who a CoS is.

episodes.title: 2. A bridge between leadership and the company
episodes.description: The role ‘Chief of Staff’ - isn’t as straightforward as you might think. It's one role, but a good CoS wears many many hats - and with each hat comes its own set of responsibilities - the most primary of them: acting as a bridge between leadership and the rest of the company, and identifying business problems.

episodes.title: 3. Bringing the house together!
episodes.description: Facilitating bringing the house together is no easy task. 10 different outlooks, 10 different teams with 10 different plans of action and so many people to talk to - who does this? …. You guessed it right!

episodes.title: 4. Driving external initiatives and growing business
episodes.description: If you were under the opinion that a Chief of Staff deals with only internal agendas - think again. One of the key responsibilities of a good CoS is to drive new initiatives and help expand the business.

episodes.title: 5. How a CoS is involved in corporate branding
episodes.description: The ‘image’ of the organization you work with is the key driver to growth and how the larger audience perceives you. And with multiple functions in a single organization, it is easy to get mis-branded based on any one. The Chief of Staff brings the branding together!

episodes.title: 6. Managing hiring and retention strategies
episodes.description: Single member team! Very very different from the role of an HR! Adopting a people-first approach. Why is the chief of staff role structured this way? And how do these aspects fall within its purview? Find out in this episode.

episodes.title: 7. Executing the developed strategies
episodes.description: CoS isn’t just the rosy role of thinking of new initiatives, ideating and interacting with multiple stakeholders to drive business. It also involves - ACTUALLY DOING IT. Execution is a key function of a CoS role and how to do and get work done subtly is the most exciting part!

episodes.title: 8. Why is the Chief of Staff role required
episodes.description: If the CoS deals with multiple departments in an organisation, why can’t the divisional heads of these departments take up the Chief of Staff’s responsibilities? In popular belief, we know that being a Jack of All and a Master of None isn’t good - but does that hold true in the CoS role?

episodes.title: 9. Skill-sets to be an efficient CoS - People Management
episodes.description: Being such a versatile role, can we really define the top few skill-sets required to be an efficient Chief of Staff? Fortunately, yes. And the most important one: People management skills. After all, as a CoS, you are talking to practically everyone in the organisation.

episodes.title: 10. Skill-sets to be an efficient CoS - Multitasking and time management
episodes.description: What if I told you that something as simple as colour coding your calendar could help you become a good Chief of Staff - sounds absurd right? But it’s true. Look into how Kapil multitasks and manages his time to be an efficient Chief of Staff.

episodes.title: 11. Skill-sets to be an efficient CoS - Strategic thinking
episodes.description: As someone driving business growth, expansion, managing internal operations and managing time and people - out of the box thinking is an obvious important skill-set. You mustn’t ONLY think as an executive, or ONLY as an employee - it has to be a subtle combination of both - that’s the trick.

episodes.title: 12.  A day in the life of a Chief of Staff
episodes.description: Is there a typical day in the life of a CoS? Nope. A week? Nope. So then what is this episode about? It’s actually a project in the life of a Chief of Staff - watch on to see what we mean.

episodes.title: 13. Where is the CoS role headed?
episodes.description: Let’s take a step back and look at the journey so far - popularity in the political space, then to the startup space, then to the larger MNCs and finally to each executive in every organisation - it’s pretty evident that this role is a MUST. And it’s not going away anytime soon.

episodes.title: 14. Conclusion
episodes.description: Just a summary of the entire session - spoon feeding you so that you ensure you haven’t missed out on anything during the episodes!

course_description: The most exciting role - that has not only survived the pandemic - but also taken the startup and tech world by storm - the Product Management role is exciting and scary from Day-1. Watch this session to get an inside view of what product management in startups is all about
WhatYouLearn: Product Management basics, meaning
The roles of a product manager
Must-have tools for PMs
Skills required to get into PM
WhatsInForYou: Lifetime access to 'inside information' in the PM space
compressed into 1 hour of learning
Preference for experiential learning opportunities that we
source for you in this domain
A certificate of completion and a chance to get your
in-session case / project reviewed by the expert

episodes.title: 1. Introducing you to PM
episodes.description: There is a new definition everytime you check the internet, so what does product management actually mean and how did it come into existence? Let's find out!

episodes.title: 2. Popular PM definitions and associations
episodes.description: A Product manager is a Mini - CEO? Product management is the same as project/program management? Product management is an intersection of business, design and tech? So many popular beliefs, which one is true?

episodes.title: 3. The Product Team and PDLC
episodes.description: User research, competitor research, design briefs, brainstorming, implementation are just some of the things a product manager needs to take care of. Let’s deep dive and find out what it is that a product manager actually does.

episodes.title: 4. Understanding current product
episodes.description: Why is it so important for a product manager to know the product in depth? How much time should we invest in understanding the product? What are the ways through which we can learn about the product?

episodes.title: 5. User research
episodes.description: Understanding user needs, user feedback. Deriving useful insights from user feedback and the importance of continuous user feedback. Everything to learn about user research in one episode.

episodes.title: 6. Market and competitor research
episodes.description: What is market research? Importance of market research? Application of competitive research in prioritisation, benchmarking performance etc. Let’s find out.

episodes.title: 7. Designing and prototyping
episodes.description: How does a product manager go about preparing a brief for the designers and the tools they use to create both low fidelity and high fidelity prototypes and designs.

episodes.title: 8. Down to execution
episodes.description: How do we go about putting our designs to the test and transforming our imagination into reality? What is the role and importance of PRDs amidst all of this?

episodes.title: 9. Release strategy
episodes.description: How do we release our product to the users? Direct release, Phase release, A/B test, which release is more appropriate for what kind of situations? How do we inform the users about our release?

episodes.title: 10. Product analytics and refining modifications
episodes.description: How do we evaluate the performance of our product? What indices do we use? North star metric, customer journey metrics, net promoter score, what do these words even mean? You won’t ask any of these questions after watching this episode.

episodes.title: 11. Tools for a product manager
episodes.description: Notion, FigJam, Balsamiq, Figma, Linear and Clevertap. Confused? These are just some of the tools which a product manager uses extensively! Let’s familiarise ourselves with these tools.

episodes.title: 12. What do organisations look for in PMs
episodes.description: Ever wondered if you have what it takes to be a brilliant product manager? Let’s discuss the ingredients to get you the recipe of success.

episodes.title: 13. Case study - Do it yourself
episodes.description: We have learnt every little detail and intricacy about the product management role, so put your knowledge to the test and help inVideo with a new feature release. Goodluck! PS: opportunities await :)

episodes.title: 14. Conclusion & the way forward
episodes.description: We have learnt how exciting and interesting the role of a product manager is, but is it sustainable? Let’s conclude by figuring out the direction in which product management as a role is headed.

Product Management in detail: 
 New feature rollouts

course_name:
Limited Partners: Investing in 
 Private Asset Funds
course_description: If you thought the buck ended at Private Equity and Venture Capital - think again. There are folks who are sitting at the top of the finance value chain - and they're called Limited Partners. Watch this series to find out who calls the shots and how investments take place at a global level
WhatYouLearn: LP investing basics, meaning
Evaluating Private Equity Funds
Investing across borders and asset classes
Skills required to be a Inv. Prof. at an LP
WhatsInForYou: Lifetime access to 'inside information' in the LP investing space
compressed into 1 hour of learning
Preference for experiential learning opportunities that we
source for you in this domain
A certificate of completion and a chance to get your
in-session case / project reviewed by the expert

episodes.title: 1. Introduction to LP investing
episodes.description: Let’s dive headfirst into the world of LP investing. What are the different types of investors, where and how do they invest? Let’s fortify our basics

episodes.title: 2. Allocation of funds
episodes.description: Billions of dollars at your disposal, hundreds of investment avenues, how do you choose?

episodes.title: 3. Deep dive into LP investment terms
episodes.description: We hear so many complicated terms batted around regularly, general partner, investment strategy, investment life cycle, investment timeline, what do these terms even mean? Let’s find out

episodes.title: 4. Evaluation of investment
episodes.description: Ever wondered what sets the expert apart from the rest? Let’s step into the mind of an LP, how they evaluate investments and the parameters they use to find hidden gems.

episodes.title: 5. What are co-investments
episodes.description: Sounds pretty self explanatory but is it? What are co-investments, why do they take place and all the terms and intricacies associated with it

episodes.title: 6. Management of investments
episodes.description: We learnt the ‘how’ of investing but what happens after we have made the investment? Do we just relax and wait for the returns to sprout? Well, I wish it were that easy.

episodes.title: 7. Exiting an LP investment
episodes.description: Exiting an investment can be a tricky and tedious process with lots of questions to be answered. Can LPs sell interest free? Can LPs sell their stake to other LPs? Can LPs sell their stake in a secondary market? Let’s find out.

episodes.title: 8. Day in the life of an LP investment professional
episodes.description: Take a peek behind the curtain, spend a day with an LP investment professional. Find out how they actually spend their time and if you have what it takes to make it as an investment professional in the LP industry.

episodes.title: 9. Future of LP industry
episodes.description: Industries which grew exponentially over the years get uprooted in the blink of an eye. Some industries are on a consistent upward trend, others are struggling. Amidst all this, where does the LP industry lie? What does the future have in store for them?

episodes.title: 10. Case study
episodes.description: Step into the shoes of a big global manager handling a private real estate fund. Can you make the right decisions and evaluate on the basis of the 5 key areas: Strategy, team, performance, benchmarking and investor profile.
